item.title: 国土安全部网络人员在特朗普驱逐行动中被重新分配工作
item.description: 据国土安全部的现任和前任雇员称，美国国土安全部已将包括网络人员在内的数百名国家安全专家调往支持唐纳德-特朗普总统驱逐行动的工作岗位，并表示将解雇任何拒绝服从的人。【原文：The US Department of Homeland Security has shifted hundreds of national security specialists, including cyber personnel, into jobs that support President Donald Trump’s deportations and said it would dismiss anyone who refuses to go along, according to current and former DHS employees.】

item.title: 无人机防御公司大涨 754%，提振澳大利亚小盘股
item.description: 由于地缘政治紧张局势加剧有利于国防承包商，金价飙升也为矿业股提供了支撑，澳大利亚小型股指数有望创下 2009 年以来的最佳业绩。【原文：An index of Australian small caps is on track for its best year since 2009, as heightened geopolitical tensions favor defense contractors and the soaring gold price supports mining stocks.】

item.title: 能源公司在日本抢购气象服务以获得交易优势
item.description: 天气预报员在日本的电力交易热潮中找到了一个有利可图的利基市场，他们向那些在世界上最动荡的电力市场中寻求优势的公司出售超级专业化的数据。【原文：Weather forecasters are finding a lucrative niche in Japan’s power-trading boom, selling hyper-specialized data to firms seeking an edge in one of the world’s most volatile electricity markets.】

item.title: 比索疲软引发价格风险，菲律宾将维持关键利率不变
item.description: 菲律宾央行预计将于周四暂停宽松货币政策，因为比索疲软有可能引发通货膨胀。【原文：The Philippine central bank is expected to pause its monetary easing on Thursday, as the weak peso risks stoking inflation.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将因美国股市上涨而上涨，中国将重新开放：市场综述
item.description: 在美国基准股市创下新高后，亚洲股市周四将继续攀升，这主要得益于与人工智能热潮相关的公司进一步上涨。【原文：Asian stocks were set to climb Thursday after US benchmarks set new highs, helped by further gains for companies linked to the artificial-intelligence boom.】

item.title: 巴西税收法案崩溃，破坏卢拉的财政战略
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）领导的政府周三未能推动国会通过一项至关重要的增收措施，从而使巴西 2026 年的财政目标面临风险，并加剧了人们对其支撑公共财政能力的怀疑。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government failed to push a crucial revenue-raising measure through Congress on Wednesday, putting Brazil’s 2026 fiscal goal at risk and intensifying doubts about its ability to shore up public finances.】

item.title: 为什么这次美国政府关门与以往不同
item.description:
在本期《特朗普经济学》中，我们将探讨华盛顿的基本动态发生了怎样的变化，以及这对经济意味着什么。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we look at how the underlying dynamics in Washington have changed and what it means for the economy.

】

item.title: 斯塔默就英国数字身份证计划向印度取经
item.description: 基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）会见了印度数字身份证计划的一位重要设计者，英国首相正就在英国实施类似系统寻求指导。【原文：Keir Starmer met with a key architect of India’s digital ID program, as the British prime minister sought guidance on implementing a similar system in the UK.】

item.title: 英国财政部严禁大臣动用紧急基金
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）试图严格控制公共开支，因此英国财政部告诉大臣们，它正在限制紧急政府基金的使用。【原文：The UK Treasury has told ministers it is clamping down on the use of emergency government funds, as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves seeks to keep a tight grip on public spending.】

item.title: 为什么 OpenAI、Nvidia 和 AMD 之间的循环人工智能交易令人瞠目结舌？
item.description:
OpenAI与Nvidia。甲骨文与 OpenAI。Nvidia与甲骨文。今天的大事件：人工智能巨头正在进行循环交易—而一些分析师对此持怀疑态度。【原文：

OpenAI and Nvidia. Oracle and OpenAI. Nvidia and Oracle. Today on the Big Take: AI giants are making circular deals — and some analysts are skeptical.

】

item.title: Seven & i 在收购失败后努力赢回投资者的青睐
item.description: 自 Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.放弃 6.77 万亿日元（444 亿美元）收购 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Almost three months have passed since Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. abandoned its ¥6.77 trillion ($44.4 billion) bid to acquire Seven & i Holdings Co., yet the stock remains 24% below the proposed price with few signs of reversing course.】

item.title: 钯金创下2023年以来最大涨幅，黄金打破新纪录
item.description: 钯金大涨近10%，创下自2023年5月以来的最大涨幅，因投资者纷纷涌入避险天堂，贵金属涨势加快。由于黄金突破 4000 美元，白银反弹，钯金攀升至每盎司 1482.65 美元，实现了三日连涨。【原文：Palladium surged nearly 10%, its biggest advance since May 2023, as gains across precious metals accelerated with investors piling into havens. The metal climbed to $1,482.65 an ounce, marking a three-day winning streak, as gold topped $4,000 and silver rallied.】

item.title: MJH 生命科学公司提高 4.3 亿美元垃圾级贷款收益率
item.description: 医疗保健媒体公司 MJH Life Sciences 被迫更改 4.3 亿美元贷款的条款，以便为收购一家营销公司提供资金。【原文：MJH Life Sciences, a healthcare media company, was forced to change the terms of a $430 million loan to help finance its acquisition of a marketing firm.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司旗下 Rockpoint Gas 在多伦多首次公开募股中募集 5.045 亿美元资金
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德的 Rockpoint Gas Storage Inc. 在首次公开募股中筹集了约 7.04 亿加元（5.045 亿美元）的资金，其股票定价为市场范围的最高价。【原文：Brookfield’s Rockpoint Gas Storage Inc. raised about C$704 million ($504.5 million) in an initial public offering, pricing its shares at the top of the marketed range.】

item.title: Corus Entertainment 债券持有人将在债转股中取得控制权
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，陷入困境的加拿大广播公司 Corus Entertainment Inc.【原文：Embattled Canadian broadcaster Corus Entertainment Inc. is moving closer to a restructuring that would give bondholders control of the equity, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 谷歌希望获得将双子座人工智能应用与地图、YouTube 捆绑的权利
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下谷歌公司的一名律师周三告诉一名联邦法官，该公司希望保留将其流行的地图和视频应用与其 Gemini 人工智能服务捆绑在一起的权利，以回击司法部禁止这种做法的提议。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google wants to retain the right to bundle its popular mapping and video apps with its Gemini AI service, a lawyer for the company told a federal judge Wednesday, pushing back on a Justice Department proposal that would bar the practice.】

item.title: 拉瓜迪亚机场航班因数据中断暂时停飞
item.description: 由于设备故障，进出纽约拉瓜迪亚机场的航班停飞了一个小时，进一步加剧了美国政府停摆期间空域的混乱。【原文：Flights in and out of the LaGuardia airport in the New York area were grounded for an hour due to an equipment outage, further adding to disruptions that have snarled the US airspace amid the government shutdown.】

item.title: 黄金三年来的惊人涨势打破了所有记录
item.description: 黄金突破每盎司 4,000 美元是三年牛市中的又一个里程碑，这三年的牛市不畏顽固的怀疑论者，打破了数十年来可靠预测黄金涨跌的分析模型。【原文：Gold’s ascent through $4,000 an ounce is yet another milestone in a three-year bull run that has defied die-hard skeptics and broken analytical models that have reliably predicted its rises and falls for decades.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯支持的加密货币公司着眼于在巴西拓展业务
item.description: 本周在巴西证券交易所上市后，加密货币公司 OranjeBTC 希望扩大其比特币持有量，并推出新的教育计划，以促进数字资产在巴西的广泛应用。【原文：After going public on Brazil’s stock exchange this week, cryptocurrency firm OranjeBTC wants to expand its Bitcoin holdings and roll out new educational programs to promote broader adoption of digital assets in the country.】

item.title: 马斯克与前推特首席执行官就拒绝支付离职金达成和解
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）和公司前身推特（Twitter）已同意解决前首席执行官帕拉格-阿格拉瓦（Parag Agrawal）和其他三名高级官员去年提起的价值 1.28 亿美元的诉讼，他们称自己被拒绝支付遣散费。【原文：Elon Musk and the company formerly known as Twitter have agreed to resolve a $128 million lawsuit filed last year by former Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal and three other top officials who said they were denied severance payments.】

item.title: 软银的 Graphcore 计划在印度投资 13 亿美元开发芯片
item.description: 软银集团旗下的英国芯片设计公司 Graphcore 计划宣布在印度投资 10 亿英镑（13 亿美元），其中包括新建一个研究中心。【原文：Graphcore, the British chip designer owned by SoftBank Group Corp., is planning to announce a £1 billion ($1.3 billion) investment package in India that includes a new research hub.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要显示资产负债表清算争论加剧
item.description: 美联储 9 月份政策会议的几位与会者表示，随着央行继续解除其庞大的证券投资组合，必须继续监测货币市场状况，并评估银行储备与 "充裕 "水平的接近程度。【原文：Several participants at the Federal Reserve’s September policy meeting said it was important to continue monitoring money-market conditions and evaluate how close bank reserves are to their “ample” level, as the central bank continues to unwind its massive portfolio of securities.】

item.title: 尽管关税收入激增，美国年度财政赤字仍稳定在 1.8 万亿美元
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室的数据显示，2025 财年联邦政府的预算赤字为 1.8 万亿美元，与 2024 财年相比变化不大，尽管关税收入激增。【原文：The federal government logged a $1.8 trillion budget deficit for the 2025 fiscal year, little changed from 2024 despite a surge in tariff revenues, according to the Congressional Budget Office.】

item.title: Eurizon 称：美元不信任推动黄金和比特币反弹
item.description: Eurizon SLJ Capital 有限公司认为，对包括美元在内的大型储备货币日益增长的厌恶情绪推动了黄金和比特币的创纪录反弹，而且这种趋势还将继续下去。【原文：The growing aversion to large reserve currencies, including the dollar, has been propelling the record rallies in gold and Bitcoin — and the trend will go on, according to Eurizon SLJ Capital Limited.】

item.title: 壳牌即将获得向特立尼达岛出口委内瑞拉天然气的美国许可证
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，壳牌石油公司正准备恢复委内瑞拉海上天然气田的前期工作，以向邻国特立尼达和多巴哥供应天然气，因为该公司对特朗普政府将颁发新的许可证，使该项目免受制裁的信心增强了。【原文：Shell Plc is preparing to resume preliminary work on a Venezuelan offshore gas field to supply neighboring Trinidad and Tobago, as its confidence grows that the Trump administration will issue a new license exempting the project from sanctions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 尽管政府关门，MapLight 仍为首次公开募股采取变通方法
item.description: MapLight Therapeutics Inc.正在采取一种很少使用的策略，以便在本月晚些时候上市，即使美国政府停摆促使其他寻求首次公开募股的公司暂缓上市。【原文：MapLight Therapeutics Inc. is adopting a rarely-used tactic to allow it to go public later this month, even as the US government shutdown prompts other companies seeking initial public offerings to hold off.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要显示，即使降息也要警惕通胀
item.description: 美联储官员表示愿意在今年进一步降低利率，但在上个月的政策会议上，许多官员因担心通货膨胀而表示谨慎。【原文：Federal Reserve officials showed a willingness to lower interest rates further this year, but many expressed caution driven by concerns over inflation at their policy gathering last month.】

item.title: 债券交易员看到数据旋风打破了停业引发的平静
item.description: 全球最大的债券市场一直陷入困境，但交易员们正准备迎接美国政府关门结束并公布大量关键经济数据后可能刮起的旋风。【原文：The world’s biggest bond market has been stuck in a rut, but traders are preparing for what could be a whirlwind of action once the US government shutdown ends and unleashes a flood of key economic data.】

item.title: 明星预测师认为墨西哥比索将因贸易协定而达到 2024 年的水平
item.description: 墨西哥即将与美国和加拿大举行的贸易谈判可能会帮助比索（今年新兴市场表现最好的货币之一）达到2024年才出现的高点。【原文：Mexico’s upcoming trade talks with the US and Canada could help the peso — a top emerging-market performer this year — reach lofty heights last seen in 2024, according to the currency’s top forecaster.】

item.title: 家用电池初创公司从风险投资公司融资 10 亿美元以扩大规模
item.description: 家用电池初创公司 Base Power Inc. 筹集了 10 亿美元资金，用于扩大其储能业务，并在得克萨斯州建立一家生产厂。【原文：Household-battery startup Base Power Inc. raised $1 billion to expand its energy-storage business and build a manufacturing plant in Texas.】
